title: Need help on font of year date
content:
Any thoughts about what the font is in this year date?  
thanks in advance

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018221730im_/http:/typophile.com/files/2013_6106.jpg)
author: alm70

comments.content:
These numbers are monoline with ball terminals, a letterform found on some manual typewiters. The closest fonts that I have found are [MVB Fantabular Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018221730/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mvbfonts/mvb-fantabular-sans/) designed by Akemi Aoi, and [Esfera NF](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018221730/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/esfera-nf/) designed by Nick Curtis based on Beton.  
Don

I think those are lining figures of Archer Semibold.  
 [http://www.typography.com/fonts/font\_overview.php?productLineID=100033](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018221730/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100033 "http://www.typography.com/fonts/font\_overview.php?productLineID=100033")

I agree, Akira, that those are the lining figures of Archer Semibold. As Martha Stewart, for whom the typeface was developed, would say "it's a good thing." A monoline slab serif with ball terminals from typewriter letterforms--a very efficient and effective design. I checked the numbers category at H&FJ but missed the numbers on the Archer page. My bad.  
Don
